    • normalizePath

      public static String normalizePath(String path)
      Normalizes resource paths/resource names.

      Removes leading/trailing slashes, ensures trailing slash.

      Note that the empty path will be normalized to "/".

      Normalized paths are valid for resource-lookup using ClassLoader.getResource(String) and ClassLoader.getResourceAsStream(String).

      Example indicating the mappings:

      • "path/to/dir/" maps to "path/to/dir/"
      • "/path/to/dir" maps to "path/to/dir/"
      • "" maps to ""
      • "/" maps to ""

      Note that for addressing the classloader, e.g. through ClassLoader.getResource(String), the root is the empty string "", while paths/directories end in "/".

      Parameters:
      path - Resource path/resource name.
      Returns:
      Normalized resource path/resource name.
